snippet: The report on Jimmy Savile documents more than 200 cases of sexual abuse, and prosecutors admitted that “shortcomings” in interviewing some victims allowed him to escape prosecution.
abstract: Report by Scotland Yard and Britain’s leading child welfare group draws horrific picture of more than 200 cases of sexual abuse of victims as young as 8 by late BBC host Jimmy Savile; prosecutors admit for first time that 'shortcomings' in interviewing some victims allowed Savile to escape prosecution before his death at age of 84 in 2011.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: The report on Jimmy Savile documents more than 200 cases of sexual abuse, and prosecutors admitted that “shortcomings” in interviewing some victims allowed him to escape prosecution.
